intro: Corydalis slivenensis, commonly known as the Slivenensis Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred petals and slender, branching stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or woodland soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, range in color from pink to purple, adding ornamental value to gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
